poem:
**The Morning News**

Amid the clang  
of gavel and guard,  
words like sparrows  
dart through halls—  
a leader's promise,  
a judge's call—  
slicing air,  
between budget lines,  
into the silent grip  
of morning light—  
politics  
feathers  
falling  
to headline earth.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump says ‘we’re only going to cut Democrat programs’ as Senate again fails to pass dueling funding bills – live 8.01pm BST Judge Perry has called a recess and has asked the lawyers representing Illinois and the administration to be back in the courtroom by 5:30pm EST. We’ll bring you more as it happens. 7.38pm BST Federal judge in Chicago hears arguments on deployment of national guard Meanwhile, in the midwest, a federal judge is". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
